Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student may draw a basic shape intended to be a fish, although it might lack distinct features or details.
The student might include random elements in the drawing, like wavy lines or irregular shapes, that could be interpreted as water.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly label water as the fish's home. (e.g., student writes random letters or doesn't use any labels)
The student might not show any correct elements that the fish needs in its environment, such as plants or animals. (e.g., includes unrelated items like cars or trees)
The student may not understand the concept of labeling different parts of the drawing. (e.g., uses scribbles or random marks instead of labels)
The student is likely unable to represent how the fish and its environment form a system where each part helps the fish survive. (e.g., fish is floating in air with no connection to habitat)
